reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been following this game ever since its Kickstarter campaign. It had a bit of a rocky start, but as time went by we backers received a nice series of very interesting updates, fixing bugs and adding new features.

Right now the game is still in Early Access, mind that. It still lacks many stuff and bugs are prone to lurk around. Having said that, this what you can play here is a beautiful experience with tons of potential. Think of it as a kind of Dwarf Fortress, but with nice (cute, even) Voxel graphics and a much, much, much kinder difficulty curve. You will begin each new game with a group of settlers, and from there on you must help them survive. Gather raw materials. Craft items. Grow plants. Build your town. Survive.

One VERY interesting feature of the game is the building system, which allows you to design your own buildings, letting your settlers do the whole construction stuff. Of course, be aware that larger building will take longer to build (as well as require more materials).

Perhaps the current price is a bit steep, but if you like this kind of game (Dwarf Fortress, Gnomoria) then StoneHearth might be just what you were looking for.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nStonehearth is a sandbox voxel city builder. It includes designing your own buildings, Promoting your hearthlings to more specialized jobs like Farmers,Blacksmiths, and Footmen. You'll of course have to harvest resources such as chopping down trees or mining for ore and stone and defend your town from would-be invaders. StoneHearth is in EA so the usual caveats are present but Radiant is diligent team and im confident they'll finish this. So if your into city-builders and dont mind the occasional bug i can reccomend Stonehearth to you. Also their website has more detailed info if you want to see future plans for the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has a good start and is a load of fun to play.  However the large amount of bugs I keep coming across prevent some simple tasks.

It'd be nice if when you start tunneling down that the villagers could at least know they need ladders to get out.

I will also point out how the interface is very simple to get the hang of.  For those who have played the game Gnomoria, the stockpile system is very similar and won't be hard to get used to.

All in all, this game has a ton of potential as a sandbox village creating game.  It just needs to be regularly updated and developed further.  After all, it still is in the early access phase!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a fun village command game where you work on building the best village you can. You can play a peaceful mode or another mode with random enemy NPCs that attack your village. The game is very fun and is still in development with lots of room to grow. They intend to eventually have a Multiplayer aspect that has me really excited to see what they come up with.

If you like innovate games or like RPG style games there is some story to the game as well. They will be adding several races over time. I recommend you purchase the game to help support it in its growth.

It has a low high end to the game but over time they will be adding more content as they get out of Alpha devolpment.  Lots of great potential in this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edit (2/16/16): I'd like to add that, since posting this review, the developers have been delivering solid updates which have given more flavor to the game, as well as made playing the game a much more enjoyable experience. I am thoroughly impressed with the developer's progress in what was already a good game in the early stages of release. This game earns my recommendation.

(6/12/15): I think this is a great game. Micromangement and creative city builders are my thing, and I'm excited to see how this game develops. However, it's buggy to the point where I'm getting the same error messages pretty consistently, and that is mildly frustrating to me.

I'm recommending this game based on its potential: if you're looking for a clean, smooth gaming experience, then I would hold off on buying this game at the present time. In hindsight, I should have waited for it to go to late beta, at least. However, I would definitely say that it's worth adding to your wishlist if nothing else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is so addicting i cant come off it i play this more than any other game i have.

First time Experience
at first i had no idea what to do (I know there is guides but im going simply from the game itself) it doesnt really explain what you do. Then i when i figured out what to do i felt quite stupid (Personally).
At first i was just gathering resources but wasnt sure what to do, but then realised you have to set you people jobs, after that i started expanding, defend my self from goblins, then built a wall round my town and have just expanded on.
Although it can be quite annoying to play due to the bugs and what have you it is only and Alpha so dont expect bug free.

Problems
Now yes it is only and alpha im not hating on it i understand but im only sharing a few bugs people should know about.

Buildings with more than floor
This can be a pain as they will get stuck on the inside of the top floor if your not planning on using the second floor.

UI
Its written in C++ json files, similar to Minecraft. so yeah can expect the kind of bugs from it, if your changing a Person job and your looking at the list it can crash and stop you from setting Jobs, saving, crafting, and other things that require the UI to pop up a menu.
(To fix this just press F5 to reset the UI)

Lag
you wont notice this till you have explored your area a bit and have at least 20 people in your town. When this happens prepare for all the Bugs. The UI system comepletely fails and stutters the game due to the all the for loops and the while scripts (Basically 24 FPS is coming your way).
(I have found a way to sort of delay the lag, when its happens Reset the UI by Press F5. this resets all the Loop Scripts causeing it to refresh all the code thats waiting or looping in the game it wont cause any harm that i know i do it and i have no problems)

Conclusion
Yes there are problems but its an alpha and this game has insane potential im sticking around for the updates and playing it daily you ignore the bugs and just get on with it. i still recommened getting this game.

After slowly getting into this game and learning the jist of things I'm beginning to find it really entertaining and taking up a lot of my time.

You start with the basics and a small ammount of villagers which is more than enough to get your first village started. The building construction does get a bit bugged out at times but hey it's early access. You do have to create each individual item for said buildings like window frames and door. Which is awesome. You get raiding parties which aren't all hard but they feel like they get progressively harder as the game goes on.

I didn't quite understand the custom building tools til after a bit of experimenting but it's really easy, even the average joe can do it. Would highly reccommend this game if you enjoy village construction.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's another early access, but why should you take the risk of buying the game before release?  This game is receiving updates every Thursday.  An update usually includes a new entity or two (some new content) and a lot of bug fixes.  While the pace seems a little slow, the updates are frequent and the two developers have a reputation of interacting with the community and effectively implenting feedback.

The developers are talented individuals with computer science degrees and related career experience.  Check out their website: http://www.radiant-entertainment.com/

They're not your average joe indie developers working out of their parents basement to make a quick buck.  These two are passionate individuals that want to create something truly enjoyable and worth playing.  That being said, Stonehearth still has many bugs and is definitely not as enjoyable now is it's destined to be.  And Stonehearth is destined to be the best Dwarf Fortress-like game of our age, that doesn't require a nerdy learning curve to actually enjoy.

Stonehearth is promised to be a depth-filled, fun adventure of building a village.  But unlike Banished or other village-builders, you will find yourself fabricating stories about your villagers as you explore, survive and build.  Just watch half the youtube Let's Plays if you don't believe me.  It's that imaginative element, that makes games like Stonehearth more than just another city-builder.  Stonehearth is not just another game, it's a journey into your own imagination as you build a village.  So, if the experience resonates with you, support this young and promising studio, as the developers craft a gem in the indie gaming world.  Personally, Stonehearth rubs off that feel-good aura, that this early access is an investment that's worth the risk!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Potential and Charm
I purchased prior to early access, Fall 2014.

If the videos appeal to you, and you are willing to put up with bugs then I feel comfortable recommending this game now.

As of 11/2015 the primary issues I have with the game are bugs. Many are fixed weekly, but I still can't quite build what I want or I have to game the AI to keep whem working.

If the developers deliver on everything it should be considerably better.

This game has a lot of potential, and I respect the developers for being very open with the community. They communicate through their blog weekly, and often push a non-stable build weekly or every other week. This game has not been abandoned like some other early access titles.

Pros:
Responsive Dev Team
Open for Mods
Great visual style
Fun personality in the writing
Extensive replayability (no two games the same)
Building interface has great potentialCons:
Buggy... it's alpha
Long dev cycle
Many features that give the game legs are not in yet (MP,Co-Op, more factions)
I purchased this because I wanted to support the developers, and I'm glad to see they are still going strong. This little game has a lot of charm, and potential. As it stands right now I check the game once a month or so just to see all the new stuff they've put in. I hit a few show-stopping bugs on my town and leave it for another month.

Looking forward to full release.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Stonehearth has come a long way very quickly and the frequent updates reflect this and show the devs aren't really going anywhere in terms of slowing down/stopping. They estimated the game would be out of early access within 8-12 months after launching in June 2015, so it is shaping up they will overshoot that target by quite a bit, but that's all pretty normal for game development.

It's already very playable and the development team are clearly talented coders, but I recommend waiting until the release as that will offer the best experience, plus they will have multiplayer then (hopefully).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is so addicting i cant come off it i play this more than any other game i have.

First time Experience
at first i had no idea what to do (I know there is guides but im going simply from the game itself) it doesnt really explain what you do. Then i when i figured out what to do i felt quite stupid (Personally).
At first i was just gathering resources but wasnt sure what to do, but then realised you have to set you people jobs, after that i started expanding, defend my self from goblins, then built a wall round my town and have just expanded on.
Although it can be quite annoying to play due to the bugs and what have you it is only and Alpha so dont expect bug free.

Problems
Now yes it is only and alpha im not hating on it i understand but im only sharing a few bugs people should know about.

Buildings with more than floor
This can be a pain as they will get stuck on the inside of the top floor if your not planning on using the second floor.

UI
Its written in C++ json files, similar to Minecraft. so yeah can expect the kind of bugs from it, if your changing a Person job and your looking at the list it can crash and stop you from setting Jobs, saving, crafting, and other things that require the UI to pop up a menu.
(To fix this just press F5 to reset the UI)

Lag
you wont notice this till you have explored your area a bit and have at least 20 people in your town. When this happens prepare for all the Bugs. The UI system comepletely fails and stutters the game due to the all the for loops and the while scripts (Basically 24 FPS is coming your way).
(I have found a way to sort of delay the lag, when its happens Reset the UI by Press F5. this resets all the Loop Scripts causeing it to refresh all the code thats waiting or looping in the game it wont cause any harm that i know i do it and i have no problems)

Conclusion
Yes there are problems but its an alpha and this game has insane potential im sticking around for the updates and playing it daily you ignore the bugs and just get on with it. i still recommened getting this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although it is still buggy in its early stages, this game has a certain potential that few games seem to achieve. Such games include StarBound, Dirty Bomb, and of course, this game. You should get it now to experience the growth of the game as it develops.

This game is tons of fun and really in-depth. All they need to fix is the inevidable bugs, and this game would be one of the greats. I reccomend this to anyone and everyone looking to create something.

Another neat feature that some games fail to achieve is having your structures that you build have a purpose, and they do. You can have a dining hall, sleeping quaters, a workshop building for your hearthlings, and more. This game greatly influences meaning in your buildings. I am willing to bet you will love this game!
-9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has a good start and is a load of fun to play.  However the large amount of bugs I keep coming across prevent some simple tasks.

It'd be nice if when you start tunneling down that the villagers could at least know they need ladders to get out.

I will also point out how the interface is very simple to get the hang of.  For those who have played the game Gnomoria, the stockpile system is very similar and won't be hard to get used to.

All in all, this game has a ton of potential as a sandbox village creating game.  It just needs to be regularly updated and developed further.  After all, it still is in the early access phase!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A good game, a few bugs here and there but my game as never crashed.

The Pluses: A game that allows you to make your own buildings (Thats why I wanted this game)
It has a easy-to-learn system
If you don't wanna buld, pre-made structures
Nice music, fits the game
When you start, your not placed in a random area (Like Minecraft, unless you choose quick start or something), but your able to choose where you want to go. It says how many trees, animals and minerals are in that area.
Your able to collect over 1000 wood in a few minutes :3

The things that might be ideas or minuses
I hope that they might add a creative mode, because I really don't want to dig for things (Digging is time consuming)
People randomly get stuck in my giant pile of items
There should be a tutorial, so if people don't know how to play, they can learn how to do the basic things
Maybe when you play survival, there is an enemy meter. The higher it is the more spawns you find. If its 4, it means that you fight 10 goblins a day, but if its 0, there aren't any spawns near you, but there will be massive hordes.

The Verdict is that it is one of the best early access games I have ever seen.
